DAVID BRENT: LIFE ON THE ROAD - OFFICIAL TRAILER [HD]
Heckler Throws Glass At Comedian

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks, what was surreal is how everyone else was so unfazed. Like it was the norm. It was in Canterbury too, it's not even that rough a town.
His expression after checking his watch is amazing.

That I had my arm chopped off by a chainsaw!
I used to work as a barman at Uni and as a favour one night I covered a shift for a friend in a really rough pub in a dodgy part of town. At that time I used to have long hair down to my shoulders and as I walked into the pub before I could even get behind the bar a local shouted that I needed my hair cut. I joked with him and asked if he was willing to do it for me, he shouted back he's got a chainsaw and is willing to do it with that. Thinking he was just kidding I told him to go get it and I'd let him give me a trim, I get behind the bar the punter leaves and my mate looks at me with a really worried look on his face. I asked what was wrong and he explained that the local was a bit of a nutter and also an arborist. I looked blankly at him and he then explained what an arborist was and I shit myself. Moments later the guy comes back into the pub waving around a roaring chainsaw and screaming "It's time for a trim!" Everyone else in the pub is laughing and I was truly shitting myself. I told him if he put the chainsaw down I'd buy him a drink to which he agreed. He left the pub, put the chainsaw away and came back in for his free pint.
I considered calling the police but my friend told me that it'd be more hassle than it's worth and the guy had had his fun. So I just went about the shift as normal. Also in that shift a 14 year old kid threatened to stab me because I wouldn't serve him and the police did actually turn up to the pub at one point to let me know one of the punters was meant to be in a mental health care centre and hadn't returned by his curfew. (This turned out to be a different guy from the chainsaw guy). After the shift ended my friend and I had a lock-in and got fucking hammered. I never worked there again.
Months later I was asked if I heard about the barman who was attacked with a chainsaw in the pub I'd done a shift in. Apparently he'd upset a local, the local has gone crazy, gone at him with a chainsaw and he'd lost an arm. Once I'd checked that there wasn't another incident I realised the story was about me and in typical 'Chinese Whispers' style, people had retold the story enough that it now ended up with me losing an arm.
I do love seeing 'The Actor Kevin Eldon'.
I think I remember this. If I remember correctly between each film showing there was a round table discussion where celebs/comics took bets as to which monster would win in each film.
Thanks
Usually I do but I was MC'ing and it was literally going to be just a couple of minutes before I brought the headline act on. I'm gutted I didn't have it on during this.

So am I.
Cheers, there's a bit afterwards that I took out because the audio had finished. Another audience member gave me their drink and as I drank it they tried to charge me for it, I joked they were the worst audience member I'd ever met. Was a crazy night.

To be fair there was a 5 minute build up which isn't caught on the audio. The guy kept trying to insult me and I kept putting him down, even his friends turned on him. He got more and more angry and offered me out for a fight several times but I laughed it off and kept going. When he realised I wasn't going to bite he snapped.
There actually wasn't any security on that night which was scary. I knew this but knew if I buckle at any point I've lost the room and he'll win. I'm from the same place as him and knew the exact type of person he was, it was all posturing. Normally a person like that would've been kicked out earlier so I just held my ground until the manager acted and removed him.
Cheers dude, appreciate it.

I said "And you thought you'd had a bad week!" It was a reference to another audience member I'd be chatting to beforehand who had just been dumped. I'm gutted there's not audio for the whole thing as the bits before and after were really funny but I've had to make do with what I have.
Haha so specific. Ok I'll keep that in mind next time I'm attacked.
To be fair I still had glass in my back. How bad did I need to get hit before I could call it a glassing?

WRITING.TITLE: In October last year I was glassed whilst performing in London. Here's the footage.

WRITING.TEXT:
This has been an on going debate with a friend of mine. She's horrified that ducks gang rape and constantly tries to stop it. I feel this is a waste of time, there are bigger social issues out there than duck rape. Don't get me wrong I'm no pro-duck rape but I'd say I'm more anti-actual rape.
Call me crazy but I just feel like policing sexually deviant ducks isn't time well spent.
This looks pretty good, I love the idea of Olivia Coleman and Julian Barrett in a dark comedy together. Will be checking this out.
